intro: Galarhoeus kitagawae, commonly known as the Japanese thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
